name: intercolonial
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
involving two or more colonies (= countries that are ruled by another country): The merchants of Mexico City then took the initiative in intercolonial trade. The constitution was devised at various inter-colonial conferences and conventions.
More examplesFewer examplesHe called the first intercolonial congress in 1690 to oppose possible French incursions.At the first intercolonial cricket match played in 1851, Tasmania beat Victoria by three wickets.At that time, their products were exported mainly to the intercolonial markets.
